entry.title: When I Am Young and Beautiful
entry.summary:
Author: wordswillwrite

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,996Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Clara Kent flinched and tried to block the noise around her. She felt surreal sitting here, at the funeral of Bruce Wayne, and she felt alone, so very alone. Or, Bruce Wayne, the most dramatic man she knows, dies quietly one afternoon in his Manor. Clara is left to pick up the pieces.

entry.title: Batman CAN'T be Non-Meta... He Isn't Is He?
entry.summary:
Author: NotSoHarmlessBatfam

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,843Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 211

Summary: Batman keeps getting "severe" injuries on missions but shrugs them off. After being insistent on being non-meta the JL start to worry. But that's just how Bruce is, he may be a cryptid, and sure injuries don't hurt him and he may also be immortal... but that doesn't mean he can't fake being non-meta, if they research too much into his kind then his children will be uncovered! But after centuries of being a cryptid he may or may not have forgotten how "average" non-meta's react and behave... at first they shrugged it off as Batman being... well Batman. But even Batman can't not react to some of these injuries... can he?

entry.title: Interviewing Superman: A Bruce Wayne Exclusive
entry.summary:
Author: Samitus

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 111,162Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 818

Summary: Bruce Wayne wore many hats: CEO by day, playboy by night, Batman when needed, and full-time father. But with Batman on an unexpected break, Bruce finds himself stepping into the role of journalist when Superman requests exclusive interviews to earn the Dark Knight’s trust. After all, who better than Bruce—allegedly Batman's 'sugar daddy'—to introduce him to the Dark Knight ? With his detective instincts kicking in, Bruce sees an opportunity to uncover Superman’s weaknesses. But interviewing an alien who seems to like everyone but him turns out to be his toughest challenge yet.

entry.summary:
Author: Nigaki

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,405Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 165

entry.title: Oseh Shalom
entry.summary:
Author: RoseJubilee

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,295Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: The war between Earth and Krypton left both planets bleeding. In need of an end, Humanity and the Kryptonians agree to a peace, one to be sealed by a contract: a marriage contract to be precise. On Earth, Batman volunteers to jump on the grenade before anyone else. He has to end this war and protect his children. On Krypton, Kara-El volunteers as a peace offering. However, Kal-El has some objections to his baby cousin marrying a violent Earth general, so he suggests an alternate plan. Ultimately, taking down General Zod and his war-mongering was always going to take the joint efforts of two men, who, in a another universe, are all but brothers, even if, in this one, they have every reason to be enemies.

entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,616Chapters: 24/25Kudos: 37

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: When Darkness Meets the Light
entry.summary:
Author: YairPL

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,749Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 25

Summary: One year after donning the cowl, Bruce Wayne is no hero. Batman is a specter of vengeance and fury, an unstable project channeling the trauma of a child still screaming in an alleyway. His mission is a self-destructive obsession, and Gotham, a black hole deserving to be purged with fire. Clark Kent, on the other hand, bears the weight of a power he believes he owes to the universe. His invincibility is not a gift, but a shield that must stand before all the pain of others, a cosmic guilt that drives him to save even those who do not want to be saved. When the Daily Planet reporter is assigned to cover Bruce Wayne's charity gala, a clash of ideologies tears away both their masks. Clark sees the deep open wound behind the playboy. Bruce feels for the first time truly seen. This is the story of how light does not always blind the darkness; sometimes, it sits beside it in silence and offers to heal its wounds. It is the journey of two men meeting at the precipice: one learning to be a hero, and the other learning to be human. And from the fragile bridge of understanding they build, the legend will be born.

entry.title: the best parts of lonely
entry.summary:
Author: Ferox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,624Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 27

Summary: Clark Kent has a pretty great thing going for him. He's the backup goalie for the Gotham Blades, the worst team in NHL history, and he's working on his journalism degree. He never has to worry about money and he's got plenty of free time to be Superman. It's all going really well. Until Bruce Wayne ruins everything. “When I asked you what you wanted for your birthday, you said you wanted the Blades to,” Bruce used air quotes which shouldn't be endearing, “win an ‘effing’ game for once in your life.” "What,” Jason barks out a laugh, “you’re gonna bribe a ref or somethin’?” “Goodness no!” Bruce cries out dramatically clutching his hands to his chest, utterly scandalized. “What do you take me for? A criminal? Of course not, Jason. I would never! I am a good influence.” Jason continues to glare at him, clearly waiting for something. “I bought the team,” Bruce announces.

entry.title: Miss the Mark
entry.summary:
Author: elihinata

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,515Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 454

Summary: Clark Kent has never shaken the feeling that he doesn’t quite belong. He grew up learning to hide—his strength, his heritage, his very self—all to protect a secret that kept him at arm’s length from everyone around him. And yet, nothing made him feel more alone than discovering the one thing his Kryptonian biology denied him: a soulmate. While every human carried a mark guiding them to someone meant just for them, Clark carried nothing. No promise. No destined other. The more time passes, the heavier that truth becomes, aching under his skin until it finally breaks him. One night, overwhelmed by longing and starved for a connection he fears he’ll never have, Clark gives in to a single reckless impulse. He kisses the one person he trusts most in this world—his best friend, Bruce Wayne.
